result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean A. Neumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspire to Manufacture/Deliver Drugs], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court, in custody and via-video from Columbia Correctional Institution.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:47 am.  Defendant filed petition for sentence adjustment.  State has objected, however, Court is obligated to have hearing.  Court will listen to def. Request.  Def. gives argument for sentence credit. State gives argument. Response by defendant. Court quotes statute and court denies motion.

NEJ/JFFO/NOC delivered to def. in LCSD 7-31-2017

Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Dean A. Neumann in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF233, 16CM108 & 16CM228.  16CM228 Ct 1 - DRI Ct 2, DRI, Ct 3 DRI, Ct 4 & 5 plea.  16CM108 SAR  15CF233 SAR  Joint recommendation Ct 1 6 yrs 3 yr initial & 3 ES  Balance of counts 2 yrs 1 yr initial & 1 yr ES  Recess for counsel to review plea questionnaire with def.  Recess 1:53 pm.  Reconvene 2:04pm  Plea questionnaire form completed for  16CM228.  Form reviewed by court.  16CM228 Ct 4 - No contest plea  Ct 5 - No contest plea.  Cts 1, 2, 3 DRI consistent with plea agreement.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for pleas.  Victim rights have been complied with for all cases.  Court will accept pleas, found guilty Ct 4  & 5.  State presents sentencing arguments.  15CF233 - 482 days sentence credit.  Revocation Packet received by counsel.  State has no corrections.  Atty Abernethy-Mays questions jail credit on 16CM108.  Sentencing arguments by Atty Abernethy-Mays.  Brief statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  Court will accept joint recommendations.  15CF233 - Ct 1 6 yrs prison 3 yr Initial & 3 yrs ES  Credit 482 days.  Outstanding obligations converted civil.  16CM108   2yrs prison 1 yr initial & 1 yr ES  277 days credit.  Concurrent.  Civil jmt for outstanding obligations.  16CM228    Ct 4 2 yrs prison 1 , &  1 Cost $200.00 DNA surcharge.  DNA sample if not already provided.   Credit of 2 days.  Concurrent.  Ct 5 same sentence as count 4.  No DNA surcharge on Ct 5, cost only.  Felony convictions rights reviewed with def.  Post conviction rights  Def is eligible for substance abuse and earned released programs.     16CM108 2 counts - same sentence on each 2 yrs prison, 1 yr initial and 1 yr extended suspervision.  All counts concurrent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Dean A. Neumann in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calledf at 1:38 pm   Cases called 15CF233, 16CM108 & 16CM228.  15CF233 & 16CM108 Sentencing after revocation  16CM228 Plea and sentencing.  Statement by Atty Abernethy Mays, requesting an adjournment, reasons given.  16CM228 requesting trial.  State withdraws agreement.  Court will grant adjournment.
Revocation Packet Summary
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

DNA Order and Acknowledgement
of Preliminary Examination

Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Dean A. Neumann in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM267, 15CM271, 15CM278, 15CF233, 15TR939 @ 9:16 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CM267 plea to ct 1 , ct 2 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed appropriate, cc,  15TR939 - plea, $937.50, 6 mo revoke, AODA, no IID. 15CM271 - plea to ct 2, ct 1 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, cc, State wil argue for 20 days jail. 15CM278 plea to charge, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, concurrent, restitution to Covantage $800, counseling deemed appropriate, cc. 15CF233, waive ph, plead to charge without park enhancer. Withheld sentence, 4 yrs probation, AODA follow through, cc, counseling deemed appropriate, State arguing for 6 mo jail consecutive to previous case. Atty Laska and Def agree. 15CF233 - Court reviews prelim waiver. Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntary. Copy of letter outlining agreement filed. Information filed, copy received. Park enhancer eliminated. 15TR939 - guilty plea. Court finds guilty. $937.50, 6 month revocation retroactive to any admin susp. AODA and follow through. No IID. Court reviews plea quest. 15CM267 ct 1 - guilty plea. 15CM271 ct 2 - guilty plea. 15CM278 - guilty plea. 15CF233 - guilty plea. Consistent with agreement - 15CM267 ct 2 dismissed and read in. 15CM271 ct 1 dismised and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laska satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM267 ct 1 disorderly conduct, 15CM271 ct 2 misd bail jumping, 15CM278 ct 1 misd theft, 15CF233 ct 1 as amended. Sentencing arguments by Counsel. State has complied with victim rights. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. 15CM267 Court will follow agreement, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. 15CM271 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, counseling, court costs, 20 days jail. Discussion regarding jail credit, will be calculated if revoked. DNA surcharge. 15CM278 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, concurrent, restitution $800 to Covantage, counseling as required, court costs including DNA surcharge. 15CF233 - Court will follow agreement withheld sentence, 4 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required, court costs, DNA surcharge, credit for 48 days if revoked. 90 days jail, consecutive to 15CM271, huber on jail time.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions. Postconviction rights. Jail commences immediately. 15TR939 - pmt plan. $100/month starting when released.
Original Bail/Bond - See 15-CM-271
Clerk's Minutes filed.
